name: Gardner
message: Why don't you give it a rest？
There's no such book you're talking about.

name: Jonathan
message: It's probably pointless to keep looking here.
We've searched so many times, haven't we?

name: Cordelia
message: But,　maybe　there's　still　a　spot　we've　missed　somewhere.

name: Jonathan
message: I don't think that's the case though...

name: Gardner
message: If you ask me, there was never any such book in the first place, it was all just a story from your dream.

name: Cordelia
message: That's not true.
Jonathan's dreams kind of overlap with reality somewhere, you know.

name: Cordelia
message: The fish ghost we saw on the iron bridge is a good example, isn't it?
Can something like that really happen by chance？

name: Gardner
message: In the first place, I don't even believe in the very existence of those strange creatures you guys saw.

name: Cordelia
message: That's enough, let's just look for it ourselves.
Gardner-san,　you　can　go　ahead　and　take　a　break.
When I found that armlet, all that was left inside was an old ship's insurance certificate and the refinery's secret ledger.
Since there’s no sign that anyone but us has been in here, there’s no way the contents could have increased.
There's no need to go looking for it or anything.

name: Cordelia
message: Why won't you open it？
You know where the key is, right?

name: Jonathan
message: There's no point in opening it, right？
When I found the Armlet, I'd already checked out the inside completely.

name: Cordelia
message: It's just to check, it's not that much trouble, right?
You got something to hide if we open it or what？

name: Jonathan
message: Anyway, there's no need to open this safe.
There　are　plenty　of　places　that　are　way　sketchier.

name: Cordelia
message: Look, there's a book on the desk！
Isn't that it？
I picked up the old book that Cordelia was pointing at on the desk.
It's quite different from the leather-bound book with creepy patterns I saw in my dream.

name: Jonathan
message: This is the refinery's ledger.
It looks totally different from the outside.

name: Cordelia
message: You never told me what kind of book it was, you know.
Can't blame me for getting it wrong.

name: Jonathan
message: Even if you ask me what it's like...
There was some weird picture drawn on it.

name: Cordelia
message: What kind？

name: Jonathan
message: I can't really explain it...

name: Jonathan
message: Anyway, this ledger definitely isn't that book. Is there anything else that looks like it？

name: Cordelia
message: I don't know... Doesn't seem like it.
It's carelessly stuck onto the plaster wall.
Since it was from when this refinery was in use, that memo must be from decades ago.
The paper's yellowed and wrinkled from dust and humidity.
Doesn't seem like anything important enough to keep for decades, though.
It's gotten all yellowed from the humidity and dust.
I guess this was something written by the person who used this office, but it's ironic that their hastily scribbled notes have outlived the person themself.
It's locked, so I can't see inside.
I wonder what kind of documents are in there, but since there's no key, it looks like checking inside is impossible.

name: Cordelia
message: I wonder if it's in here？
The door's locked, so it's pretty suspicious.

name: Jonathan
message: But when this refinery was built, stuff this convenient shouldn't have existed.

name: Jonathan
message: It's probably something from just a dozen or so years ago at most.
There's　no　way　it　could've　been　hidden　that　recently.

name: Cordelia
message: Is that so......

name: Jonathan
message: This filing cabinet is pretty new.
I don't know who did it, but the Necronomicon being hidden must've happened way back.
It's a painting where the safe's key was hidden.
There aren't any other decorations or anything, and it's obvious that the people working here don't care about comfort at all, so it's weird that there's a painting hanging on the wall.
Did the person who snuck into this room before me not notice that the key to the safe was hidden behind it?
You'd think it would be obvious at a glance...
I put the key back behind the painting like it was, but there's no way anything would turn up even if I searched the Safe now.
Looking at things like the ship's insurance papers that are as good as trash, or the secret accounts from the Refinery, wouldn't really tell me anything either.
Go outside
